metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6232 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in KArchive before 5.24, as used in KDE Frameworks, allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary files via a ../ (dot dot slash) in a filename in an archive file, related to KNewsstuff downloads.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libkf5archive5 - 5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

kdelibs-bin - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.3
kdelibs5-data - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.3
kdelibs5-plugins - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.3

criterions.comment: karchive package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1').
kde4libs package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.3').
